Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The standard Procure-to-Pay steps are listed as 1 to 8, so let me go through each step in order to see where the current model deviates.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The parallel block allows those activities to happen in any order. But in a Procure-to-Pay process, theres a specific sequence required.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: steps 4 and 5 (Receive Goods and Receive Invoice) can happen in any order? Or is there a dependency between them?

Name: Validation - NE
Text: the parallel block allows the match_invoice to be done before receiving the invoice, which is impossible. Because in the parallel block, all children can happen in any order.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait, but that would mean the sequence is fixed as 4 then 5 then 6, etc. But in reality, in some cases, the invoice might arrive before the goods are received.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The correct order for those steps after create_po is: The correct flow is: 1. create_po Then, the following steps must be in the order: - The receive_invoice (step5) must come before match_invoice (step6).

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: the receive_goods and receive_invoice can be in any order between themselves, but receive_invoice must come before the match.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The users standard logic is a strict sequence from 1-8, so the correct process tree must enforce that each step follows the next in sequence.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: the correct process tree would be a sequence of all steps in order. That way, every step must follow in order. So this would prevent any out-of-order steps.
